Description: A sherd of Egyptian red siltware pottery from the wall of a large vessel. Both surfaces are red-slipped with horizontal stripes from pebble-burnishing. The body fabric is dull red with a grey core. The original exterior surface bears an incised mark, made post-production, consisting of a straight line with two other lines diverging from it at an angle of about 45 degrees..
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 8, west of the "Qasr"
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 8 has been scratched into the object.
Bibliographic references: Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.129, p.224, pl.66)
